metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9984 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
nscd in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before version 2.20 does not correctly compute the size of an internal buffer when processing netgroup requests, possibly leading to an nscd daemon crash or code execution as the user running nscd.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu7
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu7
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu7
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu7
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu7
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu7').
